Sentencas: Controlling the oxide ion (O2-) concentration in oxides is essential to develop advanced ionic devices, i.e. solid oxide fuel cells, smart windows, memory devices, energy storage devices, and so on.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges

Sentencas: Among many oxides several transition metal (TM)-based perovskite oxides show high oxide ion conductivity, and their physical properties show high sensitivity to the change of the oxide ion concentration.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges

Sentencas: Here, the change in the oxide ion concentration is shown through the overlayer deposition on the SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 (SFCO) oxygen sponge film.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges

Sentencas: We grew SFCO films followed by the deposition of two kinds of complex oxide films under exactly the same growth conditions, and observed the changes in the crystal structure, valence states, and magnetic ground states.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges

Sentencas: As the NSMO overlayer grows, strong evidence of oxidation at the O K edge is shown.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges

Sentencas: In addition, the Fe4+ feature is revealed, and the electron valence state of Co increased from 3 to 3.25.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges

Sentencas: The oxide ion concentration of SFCO changes during layer growth due to oxidation or reduction due to differences in chemical potential.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges

Sentencas: The present results might be useful to develop advanced ionic devices using TM-based perovskite oxides.
Titulo: Overlayer deposition-induced control of oxide ion concentration in SrFe0.5Co0.5O2.5 oxygen sponges
